, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the\nloss of their primary source of EASY income, and thus their value ( ulterior\nand vested ) to the King's coffers, Jews became expendable to the Crown and\nwere expelled from England in 1290, not to be readmitted until 1655. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They had their revenge \u2013didn\u2019t they ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even today the English\ndoes NOT know why their King kicked out the Jews .&nbsp; The Jews had this bizarre practice of kidnapping\nCatholic children at Easter and using them in ritual practices- and using their blood for Passover ceremonies ( this blogsite does NOT vouch for this horrid rumor )&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">41 year old Martin\nLuther full of health problems married 26 year old Katharina von Bora a run\naway nun from the Nimbschen Cistercian convent in April 1523.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Martin Luther had been\nsuffering from M\u00e9ni\u00e8re's disease, vertigo, fainting, tinnitus, cataract in one\neye, kidney/ bladder stones, &nbsp;arthritis, &nbsp;ruptured an ear drum , angina etc \u2013 but Jew\ndoctors took care of him .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jewish doctors have Ayurveda knowledge and Ayurvedic\n&nbsp;herbs too. &nbsp;&nbsp;These\ndoctors could influence kings \u2013 sometime without their knowledge as male heirs\nwould die in infancy mysteriously or queens would become infertile. King Henry\nVIII died in 1547, only one year after Martin Luther.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Monk Martin Luther's\nwedding set the seal of approval on clergy marriage&nbsp; .&nbsp; He\nproduced 6 children.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Luther wrote a German\nMass, which he published in early 1526.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1529, he wrote the\nLarge Catechism, a manual for pastors and teachers, as well as a synopsis, the\nSmall Catechism, to be memorized by the people themselves. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL SYSTEMS WERE KEPT\nIN PLACE BY LUTHER BEFORE KING HENRY VIII WOULD LAUNCH THE NEW RELIGION IN\nENGLAND.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Till Martin Luther\nwedges out Protestant Christianity, he PRAISED the Jews.&nbsp; He wrote \u201cthe Jews are blood-relations of our\nLord; if it proper to boast of flesh and blood, the Jews belong more to Christ\nthan we.\u201d&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;He used to meet Rabbis to explain his\ninterpretation of certain Old Testament messianic passages. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his article \u201cJesus\nChrist was born a Jew,\u201d written in 1523, Martin Luther sympathized with Jews-\n\u201cif I had been a Jew and had seen such dolts and blockheads govern and teach\nthe Christian faith, I would sooner have become a hog than a Christian.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because of pro-Jew statements\nand his bizarre love for Hebrew, Martin Luther\u2019s Catholic enemies accused him\nof being a crypto-Jew trying to destroy the papacy. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Catholic tongues went awag.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Wittenberg, Luther\nwas once visited by a group of Rabbis and they were closeted with him for hours.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I GUESS THEY TOLD HIM\nTO PUT EVER BODY IN FOG\u2014 FOR THAT HOUR ONWARDS MARTIN LUTHER STARTED ABUSING\nTHE JEWS \u2013 &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AND ALL NOTED A STRANGE THING\n-- &nbsp;THE JEWS NEVER GAVE BACK AS GOOD AS\nTHEY GOT .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN ASKED WHY THE\nSUDDEN&nbsp; U TURN \u2013 LUTHER GAVE A LAME\nEXPLANATION.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HE CLAIMED THAT ONE\nRABBI INSULTED JESUS CHRIST . . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LUTHER REPEATED THIS\nDOZENS OF TIMES IN AN UNSOLICITED MANNER..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hold it\u2014I just sprouted\nlong ears YET YENAOTHER time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BBBRRRRRAAAYYYYYYYY&nbsp; !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MARTIN LUTHER SHOWED\nTHE WORLD THAT HE WAS NOT A JEW BY SEVERAL SURPRISING STATEMENTS ( FOR A MAN\nWHO DRIPPED HONEY ON JEWS BEFORE )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His early letters in\nthe 1520s regarding the Jews are extremely positive. He said, for instance,\nthat the Jews were the only ones who properly saw the ills of the Church. It\u2019s\nno wonder that they rejected the Pope and never became Catholics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Luther warned\nChristians to be on their guard against Jews since in their synagogues \u201cnothing\nis found but a den of devils in which sheer self-glory, conceit, lies,\nblasphemy, and defaming of God and men are practiced most maliciously.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Luther claimed the Jews\nhad sunk into \u201cabysmal, devilish, hellish, insane baseness, envy, and arrogance.\u201d\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He said they were \u201cfull\nof the devil\u2019s feces\u201d and the synagogue was an \u201cevil slut.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He went on with such\npoisonous rhetoric for 65,000 words.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Luther called on\nprinces and nobles to burn down synagogues and Jewish schools, raze Jewish\nhomes, forbid Jewish teaching or texts, confiscate Jewish wealth, and expel\nJews from Germany. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He at one point even\nregrets their survival: \u201cwe are at fault in not slaying them.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WZl-zI-e8bw/VQhJ65N_9SI/AAAAAAAA2YM/ogmtMRBCtPs/s1600/dow34nload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WZl-zI-e8bw/VQhJ65N_9SI/AAAAAAAA2YM/ogmtMRBCtPs/s1600/dow34nload.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Luther\u2019s last words\never spoken from a pulpit was a declaration that if Jews refused to convert \u201cwe\nshould neither tolerate nor suffer their presence in our midst!\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Going beyond mere\nsuggestions, Luther was complicit in driving Jewish citizens from Germany where\nhe could.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So all Catholic\nsuspicions of Martin Luther being a CRYPTO JEW were laid at rest .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But Hey, later Goebbels\nwould lay his hands on these anti semitic writings ( cooked and uncooked ) to\nuse it for anti-Jewish propaganda.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some\narticles in Julius Streicher\u2019s Der Sturmer \u2014 the leading Nazi propaganda paper\n\u2014 were verbatim quotations from Luther.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MARTIN LUTHER COULD NOT\nHAVE TAKEN ON THE MIGHTY CHURCH ( even templar knights were roasted alive ) WITHOUT HUGE MONEY POWER BACKING HIM &nbsp;- &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- &nbsp;HUGE BRIBES\nPAID BY CRYPTO JEWS TO THE RIGHT PEOPLE - &nbsp;RANGING FROM KINGS TO POPES .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Enter King Henry VIII ,\n&nbsp;our screw master\u2014 nay screw grandmaster\n!<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">First let me dedicate a\nsong to him and his daughter Queen Elizabeth 1 \u2013 both protestants.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/QfnD3fsDD5E/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/QfnD3fsDD5E?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My wife studied in\nAuxilium convent Mumbai. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Henry \u2013Liza song was always sung when\nthey went in a bus/ train for a picnic accompanied by nuns. &nbsp;It was an interesting song as the husky female\n&nbsp;voices had to sing for Henry and the\nsopranos for Liza.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/C3LtEUOb7i4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/C3LtEUOb7i4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The song above was also\na favourite\u2014for the tiny school girls were not allowed to say \u201c but she didnt get\nher ASS &nbsp;wet not yet \u201c&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">ASS</b> that had to say <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">AH AH.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- or the prim and propah nuns would glare and frighten them .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The song below was always sung -- OH SUSANNA DONT YOU CRY FOR ME !</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ToOcNxugGvM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/ToOcNxugGvM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enough of nursery\nrhymes \u2013it aint good to digress this way--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Henry VIII converted\nthe whole of England to Protestant Christianity. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>But his daughter Queen Mary converted England\nback to Catholic Christianity and she identified and burnt all the crypto Jews\non the stake. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>After\nQueen Mary died her half sister Queen Elizabeth 1 converted England back to Protestant\nChristianity and she roasted all of Mary\u2019s supporters.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Henry VIII died in\n1547 of syphilis.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-upru_bM1wnA/VQesbj_Tg7I/AAAAAAAA2Vk/CZjvrqAZWVY/s1600/00aragon5.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-upru_bM1wnA/VQesbj_Tg7I/AAAAAAAA2Vk/CZjvrqAZWVY/s1600/00aragon5.jpg\" width=\"502\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mary Tudor, or \u201cBloody\nMary\u201d as she came to be known, was the eldest daughter of King Henry VIII and\nhis first wife, Catherine of Aragon; becoming Queen of England in 1553.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3M43LQeAyN0/VQesQ0rALrI/AAAAAAAA2Vc/dRnyVk1bSE0/s1600/Maria_Tu2ddor1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3M43LQeAyN0/VQesQ0rALrI/AAAAAAAA2Vc/dRnyVk1bSE0/s1600/Maria_Tu2ddor1.jpg\" width=\"302\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She inherited\ncongenital syphilis from her father and was sickly, suffering from frequent\nmigraines and bald. She inherited the throne from her step brother Edward VI\nwho ruled England for 6 years and died at the age of 15--again having inherited\ncongenital syphilis from his father. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As soon as she became\nqueen she imprisoned (in the dark tower of London)&nbsp; her half sister Elizabeth I for a year --the\ndaughter of Anne Boleyn -- who became queen after her death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Henry VIII is the King\nwho beheaded his 3rd wife Anne Boleyn, on trumped up false charges of\nincest&nbsp; , ( she had made the mistake of\nsaying in public that he was NOT great in bed.) Mary's husband Phillip (\nSpanish ) was NOT physically attracted to her --and she was always frustrated .\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mary died in 1558 and\nher half sister Bhargen\u2014nay\u2014virgin queen Elizabeth I ruled for a long time till\nher death in 1603 . Queen Elizabeth 1 , by her own admission bathed only 4\ntimes in a year, and that too alone&nbsp; -\n\" whether I needed it or not!\"\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elizabeth 1 had more\nthan 2000 of those funny extravagant dresses with hilarious frilled\ncollars.&nbsp; The whole idea was to distract\nattention from her repulsive ugliness--one way or the other-- including a\njarring red coloured wig.&nbsp; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She filled up the\nhideous deep pox pits on her face, using a compound including white lead, which\nate away her skin.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Queen Elizabeth 1 was\n25 years old when she became Queen and ruled England for 44 years until age\n69.&nbsp; Philip II of Spain had been\nco-monarch of England until the death of his wife, Queen Mary I of England , in\n1558.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Queen Elizabeth 1 was\nincapable of conceiving , and had many young \u201cgay\u201d suitors who used her wrong\nbottom orifice. &nbsp;&nbsp;She used to fake pregnancies . &nbsp;Her most loved gay lover was the Earl of\nLeicester who died after the Spanish Armada visit , devastating her&nbsp; . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She could NOT fool her\nsubjects that her young male lovers used her bottom vaginal orifice .&nbsp; She left a will that nobody can see her body\neven after her death \u2013with a tiny dong and a gaping as$hole.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Initially Elizabeth\nsupported the Protestants in secret. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;But\nin 1584, she with the secret financial support of Jews , openly started\nsupporting the rebel Protestants in the Netherlands who were revolting against\nSpanish occupation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first act of\nElizabeth\u2019s&nbsp; first Parliament established\nher supremacy in all matters spiritual and temporal. The Catholic Bishops had\nopposed the Act of Supremacy in House of Lords and refused to swear the oath of\nsupremacy incorporated in the Act.&nbsp; They\nwere deprived, imprisoned or allowed to resign.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In January 1570 Pope\nPius V issued a Bull declaring Elizabeth a heretic, and therefore\nexcommunicated.&nbsp;The new ruler might have\nbeen Mary Stuart, \"Queen of Scots\" - a Catholic brought up in France\n- but in 1587 Elizabeth had Mary beheaded on false charges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Author Steve Berry\ntalks about his book \"The King's Deception\" on an American talk\nshow,&nbsp; and he alleges that Queen\nElizabeth I was not a woman.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They showed\na picture of her, and she really looks like a man behind all that thick white\nmakeup and false orange hair.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the book Steve Berry\ntraces the idea of Elizabeth as a man to the legend of the Bisley Boy, which he\nheard in 2010 when he was in the village of Ely, north of London.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>The legend says\nPrincess Elizabeth died when she was 12 or 13 while living in the village of\nBisley in Gloucestershire.&nbsp;&nbsp; Her\ngoverness was so afraid of the girl's father, Henry VIII, she quietly buried\nthe princess and substituted a CHAKKA boy from the village.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>\"For 300 years, up\nuntil the early part of the 20th century, the village of Bisley paraded a\nlittle boy dressed up as a girl\".&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Why would they do that?\"&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Berry asked. \"I was intrigued by this\nstory. I knew there was a novel here, a great adventure for Malone.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"All her life she\nwore heavy face paint and wigs.&nbsp;&nbsp; She\nwore clothing that hid her body and refused to allow doctors to examine her\nbelow the neck. Her No. 1 job was to have a child, but she refused. When she died\n(in 1603), her body could not be viewed or autopsied.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-m-sIP-by-GQ/VQew9srRCzI/AAAAAAAA2WI/B6R0oGRJRNg/s1600/do99wnlnt6oad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">John\nBull is sick and tired of LIES about the royals.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2337774/Is-proof-Virgin-Queen-imposter-drag-Shocking-new-theory-Elizabeth-I-unearthed-historic-manuscripts.html\">http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2337774/Is-proof-Virgin-Queen-imposter-drag-Shocking-new-theory-Elizabeth-I-unearthed-historic-manuscripts.html</a><i><o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>WAS&nbsp; QUEEN &nbsp;ELIZABETH\n1&nbsp; A&nbsp;\nMAN ?</b></span><i style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nbones of Elizabeth I, Good Queen Bess, lie mingled with those of her sister,\nBloody Mary, in a single tomb at Westminster Abbey.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But are they really royal remains \u2014 or\nevidence of the greatest conspiracy in English history?<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If\nthat is not the skeleton of Elizabeth Tudor, the past four centuries of British\nhistory have been founded on a lie.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And\naccording to a controversial new book, the lie began on an autumn morning 470\nyears ago, when panic swept through a little group of courtiers in a manor\nhouse in the Cotswold village of Bisley in Gloucestershire.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Could\nthe virgin queen be a part of the biggest deception in British history?<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nking, Henry VIII, was due at any hour. He was travelling from London, in great\ndiscomfort \u2014 for the 52-year-old monarch was grossly overweight and crippled by\nfestering sores \u2014 to visit his daughter, Elizabeth.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nyoung princess had been sent there that summer from the capital to avoid an\noutbreak of plague. But she had fallen sick with a fever and, after weeks of\nbleeding, leeches and vomiting, her body was too weak to keep fighting. The\nnight before the king\u2019s arrival, his favourite daughter, the only child of his\nmarriage to Anne Boleyn, had been dangerously ill. In the morning, Elizabeth\nlay dead.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elizabeth\u2019s\ngoverness, Lady Kat Ashley, and her guardian, Thomas Parry, had good reason to\nfear telling the king this awful news. It would cost them their lives. Four of\nHenry\u2019s children had died in infancy and, of the survivors, one \u2014 Edward \u2014 was\na sickly boy of five and the other an embittered, unmarried woman in her late\n20s.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nten-year-old Elizabeth was Tudor England\u2019s most valuable child in many ways.\nShe could surely be married to a French or Spanish prince to seal an\ninternational alliance \u2014 and her own children would secure the Tudor dynasty\nHenry so desperately craved.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now\nshe was dead, and when the king discovered it, Parry and Lady Ashley would\nsurely be executed. Their sole duty had been to keep the princess safe: failure\nwas treason. The penalty would not even be beheading, but death by the most\ngruesome torture imaginable.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They\nwould be bound and dragged through the mud for a mile to the scaffold. There\nthey would be hanged, cut down and disembowelled. Their entrails would be\nhauled from their bodies and held in front of their faces as they died, and\nthen their limbs would be hacked off and displayed on spikes, to be picked bare\nby the birds.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their\nonly chance of concealing the truth, and perhaps buying themselves a few days\nto flee the country, was to trick the king.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kat\nAshley\u2019s first thought was to find a village girl and dress her up in the\nprincess\u2019s robe, with a mantle, to fool the king. Bisley was a tiny hamlet,\nhowever, and there were no female children of Elizabeth\u2019s age.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But\nthere was a boy, from a local family called Neville. He was a gawky, angular\nyouth a year or so younger than Elizabeth, who had been the princess\u2019s\ncompanion and fellow pupil for the past few weeks.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And with no time to look further afield for\na stand-in, Parry and Lady Ashley took the desperate measure of forcing the boy\nto don his dead friend\u2019s clothes.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Remarkably,\nthe deception worked. Henry saw his daughter rarely, and was used to hearing\nher say nothing.&nbsp; The last time she had\nbeen presented in court, meeting the new Queen Catherine Parr, she had been\ntrembling with terror.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nprincess was known as a gentle, studious child, and painfully shy \u2014 not a girl\nto speak up in front of the king who had beheaded her mother.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So\nwhen \u2018she\u2019 stood at Bisley manor, in the dimness of an oak-beamed hall lit by\nlatticed windows, it was not so surprising that the king failed to realise he\nwas being duped.&nbsp; He had no reason to\nsuspect his daughter had been ill, after all, and he himself was tired and in\npain.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But\nafter he left later that afternoon, the hoax began in earnest. Parry and Lady\nAshley realised that if they ever admitted what they had done, the king\u2019s fury\nwould be boundless. They might get out of the country to safety, but their\nfamilies would surely be killed.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On\nthe other hand, few people had known the princess well enough to be certain of\nrecognising her, especially after an interval of many months. This boy had\nalready fooled the king, the most important deception.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile,\nthere was no easy way to find a female lookalike, and replace the replacement.\nAs the courtiers buried the real Elizabeth Tudor in a stone coffin in the manor\ngrounds, they decided their best hope of protecting themselves and their\nfamilies was to teach this Bisley boy how to be a princess.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of\ncourse this entire theory sounds absurd, given that every child grows up with\ntales of our glorious Virgin Queen, celebrated by Shakespeare and venerated in\ninnumerable plays, songs and films over the centuries.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And\nyet the many corroborating details around this extraordinary tale about the\nBisley boy were enough to convince the 19th-century writer Bram Stoker, most\nfamous as the author of Dracula. He included the story as the final chapter in\nhis&nbsp; book, Imposters.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stoker\nhad heard persistent stories that a coffin had been discovered by a clergyman\nat Bisley during the early 1800s, with the skeleton of a girl dressed in Tudor\nfinery, even with gems sewn onto the cloth.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\nseemed to chime with local legends persisting for centuries that an English\nmonarch had been, in reality, a child from the village.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Above\nall, Stoker believed, it was the most plausible explanation&nbsp; why Elizabeth, who succeeded to&nbsp; the throne in 1558, aged 25,&nbsp; never married.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her\nmost urgent duty, as the last of the Tudor line, was to provide an heir \u2014 yet\nshe described herself as a Virgin Queen, and vowed she would never take a\nhusband, even if the Emperor of Spain offered her an alliance with his oldest\nson.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She\nstayed true to that oath, provoking a war which almost ended in Spanish\ninvasion in 1588. But Elizabeth did not waver \u2014 and never even took an\nacknowledged lover.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She\nwas fond of proclaiming that she was more of a king than a queen. \u2018I have the\nheart of a man, not a woman, and I am not afraid of anything,\u2019 she declared.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her\nmost famous speech, to her troops at Tilbury as the Spanish Armada approached,\nwas cheered to the skies as she roared: \u2018I have the heart and stomach of a\nking, and of a king of England, too.\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">American\nauthor Steve Berry believes Elizabeth could have been telling the literal truth\n\u2014 that she had the heart of a man, because her body was male. He has spent 18\nmonths researching the conspiracy for his novel The King\u2019s Deception, a Dan\nBrown-style thriller set in 21st-century London.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Could\nthe real reason the 'Virgin Queen' never married was that she was secretly a\nman?<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For\nBerry, who has written 12 thrillers, the trail began with a chance question\nduring a tour of Ely Cathedral in Cambridgeshire three years ago. \u2018I always ask\nif there are any secrets or mysteries, and the guide told me: \u201cThere\u2019s nothing\nat Ely but I\u2019ve heard an incredible rumour in the Cotswolds.\u201d\u2009\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sceptical\nat first, Berry uncovered tantalising hints and references in books and ancient\nmanuscripts.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nthe \u2018princess\u2019 reached her teens, for instance, she was assigned a tutor named\nRoger Ascham, who was puzzled by her behaviour.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018The\nconstitution of her mind,\u2019 he wrote, \u2018is exempt from female weakness, and she\nis embued with a masculine power of application\u2009\u2026\u2009In the whole manner of her\nlife she rather resembles Hippolyte than Phaedra.\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That\nlast, classical allusion was quite venomous: Phaedra was an ancient princess\ndriven mad by her lust for men, while Hippolyte was queen of the Amazons, who\nlived without any need for men at all. Most convincing to Berry were the\ncontemporary portraits, which are reproduced in his novel.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One\npicture exists of Elizabeth as a child, attributed to the court painter William\nScrots. She had slender shoulders, a delicate neck and a heart-shaped face with\nginger hair and eyebrows.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nthe next known portrait, shortly after she was crowned queen, her broad\nshoulders and neck are disguised with heavy furs. She is wearing a wig, and her\neyebrows are plucked bare. Her jaw is heavy and square.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All\nsubsequent pictures of the queen were painted to an ideal, showing Elizabeth as\nshe wished to be seen, not as she was.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even\nthe official portrait commissioned after her death by her chief adviser, Sir\nRobert Cecil, conformed to what was known as \u2018The Mask Of Youth\u2019 \u2014 the\nidealised face of the monarch, which never aged.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many\nTudor courtiers suspected that Elizabeth had a deep secret. Lord Somerset was\nthe power behind the boy king Edward VI\u2019s throne, after Henry VIII died in 1547\nwhen Elizabeth was just 13.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One\nof his spies, Sir Robert Tyrwhitt, wrote to him: \u2018I do verily believe that\nthere hath been some secret promise between my Lady, Mistress Ashley, and the\nCofferer [Thomas Parry, the principal officer of the court] never to confess to\ndeath, and if it be so, it will be never gotten of her, unless by the King\u2019s\nMajesty or else by your Grace.\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nmodern English: \u2018I am certain Lady Ashley and Thomas Parry have a secret, and\nthat there is a pact between them to take it to the grave. If that\u2019s the case,\nthe only people who could force them to divulge this secret are you and the\nKing.\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those\nwere ominous words: only Somerset and the King had the right to put a suspect\nto the rack, using torture to extract information.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bram\nStoker believed it was the sheer scale of the deception that made it possible.\nWhen Elizabeth returned to London from Bisley, more than a year after she first\nleft the court, it would have been treason for any sceptics to suggest \u2018she\u2019\nwas not the king\u2019s daughter.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018It\nis conceivable,\u2019 Stoker remarked drily, \u2018that in the case of a few individuals,\nthere might have been stray fragmentary clouds of suspicion.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018After\na time, even suspicion became an impossibility. Here was a young woman growing\ninto womanhood whom all around her had known all her life \u2014 or, what was\nequivalent, believed they had.\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any\ndifferences in her appearance were dismissed as the natural effects of growing\nup. Elizabeth had been a timid child \u2014 now she was a bold and imperious\nadolescent.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As\na little girl, she was exceptionally bright, poring over her books and learning\nas quickly as her tutors could teach her; now she was slower at her lessons\nand, though far from stupid, more academic plodder than prodigy.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her\ntutor was warned to make her lessons shorter. Roger Ascham commented that the\ngirl who had been said to soak up facts like a sponge was now more like a\nshallow cup \u2014 if wine was poured in too quickly, it would simply splash out\nagain.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kat\nAshley and Thomas Parry \u2014 the pair who are suspected of carrying out the\ndeception \u2014 remained loyal to the sovereign throughout their lives, as\nEngland\u2019s political pendulum swung wildly after the death of Henry VIII.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During\nEdward VI\u2019s reign, they were Elizabeth\u2019s closest friends, and they stood by\n\u2018her\u2019 during her years of imprisonment in the Tower when her Catholic sister\nMary was queen and decided the safest place for Elizabeth was under lock and\nkey, where she could not threaten the throne.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nMary died at the age of 42, one of Elizabeth\u2019s first acts as queen was to make\nLady Ashley her First Lady of the Bedchamber.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For\nthe next seven years, she controlled all access to the young monarch. Elizabeth\nwas devastated when Ashley died in 1565, and went into heavy mourning. Thomas\nParry was knighted, and made a Privy Counsellor and Comptroller of the\nHousehold \u2014 the richest rewards Elizabeth could bestow.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He\nwas a bad-tempered man who made many enemies, and few at court grieved when he\ndied in 1560 \u2014 one wag said he expired \u2018from mere ill-humour\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Steve\nBerry believes the queen must have confessed her secret to her chief minister,\nWilliam Cecil. The politician had a reputation for an almost supernatural\nability to read people and discover facts: she needed Cecil to understand that\na marriage would not just have&nbsp; been\npointless, it would have&nbsp; been ruinous.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If\nher secret was betrayed, the country could be plunged into civil war. There was\nno obvious heir, and Mary\u2019s former husband was now Britain\u2019s greatest enemy,\nPhilip II of Spain. Certainly, Cecil was surprisingly stoic about the queen\u2019s\ndetermination never to wed.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Publicly,\nElizabeth sometimes claimed that people needed to feel their monarch was wedded\nto the whole country, rather than one man. On other occasions, she hinted that\nthe debacle of her father\u2019s six wives, and her mother\u2019s death at the block, had\nput her off marriage for life.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If\nthose reasons sound flimsy, the queen\u2019s determination to control her image was\niron.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She\nwore thick make-up ( to hide the beard stubble ) and heavy wigs at all times: no one was permitted to see her\nwithout them. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And\nshe controlled her succession with equal ruthlessness.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On\nher deathbed, she commanded that the crown must go to her cousin\u2019s son \u2014 James\nVI of Scotland, whose mother was Mary Queen of Scots. But the command itself\nwas cryptically worded: \u2018I will have no rascal to succeed me, and who should\nsucceed me but a king?\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Was\nthere a hint in those words that for 45 years the figure on the throne had\nherself been a \u2018rascal\u2019, playing a part? Author Steve Berry believes there is\nonly one way to discover the truth. After Elizabeth died in 1603, there was no\nautopsy.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; The throne found it was able to make good use of these\nexotic merchants with their overseas contacts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She had given her\ndoctor Lopez in 1589&nbsp; a monopoly on the\nimportation of spices from Kerala .&nbsp; He\ntried his Jewish hand too much and got punished.&nbsp; Lopez was arrested on 1 January 1594, and\nhanged, drawn and quartered on 7 June 1594.&nbsp;\nJust few minutes before Lopez was hanged,&nbsp; he shouted to the crowd that he loved Jesus\nas much as he loved Elizabeth. For that insult he was drawn and quartered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1656, Rabbi Menasseh\nben Israel of Amsterdam, born Manuel Dias Soeiro in Lisbon, the son of a New\nChristian nail vendor, convinced Oliver Cromwell it would be just and\nprofitable to allow Jews to return to England.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nAll this was hog wash as Crypto Jews masquerading as Protestants settled\nin England during the reigns of King Henry VIII and Elizabeth I.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In December 1656\nAntonio Fernandes Carvajal, the leader of a small group of settlers, acquired\nland for a Jewish cemetery, a public statement of existence . In 1657 the\nprivate synagogue in Creechurch Lane had hundreds of Jewish worshippers.&nbsp; Ashkenazi Jews from Germany and Poland\nfounded their first synagogue in1692 in Broad Street, Mitre Square.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oliver Cromwell was\nfinanced by the Jews. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I will devote a\nseparate post on Oliver Cromwell later.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was an agent of\nEdomite Jews who conspired to&nbsp; usurp the\nthrone of England out from under King Charles the II. They were not of the&nbsp; blood line of Jacob/Israel but were in fact\ndescendants of Esau/Edom as described in Genesis chapter 28. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They were impostors who\nclaimed&nbsp; to be of the house of Israel and\nare referred to in Revelation 2:9 and 3:9 as jews, \"which say they are\nJews, (of the tribe of Judah) and are&nbsp;\nnot, but do lie,\" and the lie continues up to this present\nday!&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bribed Oliver Cromwell\nplayed the Jewish ball and re-admitted the Jews to England in 1657. Soon, the\neconomy of England began to suffer from the effects of Jewish usury, known as\nthe thievery of&nbsp;&nbsp; fractional reserve\nbanking. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since that fateful day,\nthe British people have slowly been bled of all their wealth and their vast\nempire. Cromwell slaughtered English Catholics while courting the foreign Jews.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Poor Christian John\nBull , he knows sh#t about his own history .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is NOT correct that\nKing Henry VII converted to Protestant Christianity to marry again and have a\nmale heir.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;By his first wife Catherine he produced 3 male\nchildren, all of whom died mysteriously thanks to his implicit trust on Jewish\ndoctors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He had produced several\nchildren with dozens of mistresses \u2013&nbsp; all\nof these affairs were very short lasting from few days to few months. He was\nnever sure if a child was his or somebody elses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But his affair with\ngorgeous Elizabeth Blount &nbsp;( below) lasted 8 years .&nbsp;\nShe caught the kings eye as a teenager when she was a maid-of-honour to\nthe King's wife, Catherine of Aragon. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-eud0cBudJM4/VQfA69E716I/AAAAAAAA2XE/zbQ0_MjU_KY/s1600/Elizabeth_Blount3d_medium.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-eud0cBudJM4/VQfA69E716I/AAAAAAAA2XE/zbQ0_MjU_KY/s1600/Elizabeth_Blount3d_medium.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 15 June 1519, Blount\nbore the King an illegitimate son who was named Henry FitzRoy. He was the only\nillegitimate son of Henry VIII whom the King proudly acknowledged as his own\nand that too in public.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; On 22 February 1511\nthe young prince died suddenly, living only 52 days.&nbsp; In 1513, Catherine was pregnant again.&nbsp; Catherine had lost another son when Henry\nreturned from France. &nbsp;He died shortly after birth.&nbsp; In December 1514, she had another son, Prince\nHenry who died shortly after birth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the first five years of his rule in Geneva, 58 Catholics were executed by this Jew and 76 exiled for their religious beliefs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calvin allowed no art\nother than music, and even that could not involve instruments. Under his rule,\nGeneva became the center of Protestantism, and sent out pastors to the rest of\nEurope, creating Presbyterianism in Scotland, the Puritan Movement in England\nand the Reformed Church in the Netherlands.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CRYPTO JEWS ( Marranos\n), outwardly Catholic, remained Jews in their hearts, secretly observing\nessential Judaism to the twentieth century, despite nearly 300 years of\npersecution by the Inquisition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1492, the Sephardic\nJews (i.e. Iberian as contrasted with Ashkenazi from Germany/Poland) were\nexpelled from newly created Spain. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1499 Ferdinand and\nIsabel expelled the Jews from Spain\u2014a measure which was speedily imitated in\nPortugal and Navarre.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
