font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PLANTS BREATHE OUT\nCARBON DI OXIDE AT NIGHT&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/xEGBAug46-E/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/xEGBAug46-E?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Historically, a rise in\nCO2 concentrations did not precede a rise in temperatures, but actually lagged\ntemperature by 300 to 800 years.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ntemperature drives the CO2, not vice versa. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9ctB8LHlLAA/VPXCYEQs4wI/AAAAAAAA1v4/zDjnQRMucRM/s1600/vostok-co26J.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9ctB8LHlLAA/VPXCYEQs4wI/AAAAAAAA1v4/zDjnQRMucRM/s1600/vostok-co26J.png\" width=\"592\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>The tears in the eyes did NOT precede the kick\non the balls.&nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/82p-DYgGFjI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/82p-DYgGFjI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serbian geophysicist\nMilutin Milankovi\u0107 &nbsp;said-- &nbsp;\u201c Changes in the orbit of the Earth around the\nsun are influencing the incoming radiation and this is the pacemaker for\nglacial-interglacials\u201d</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The PRECESSION\nrepresented by Vishnu Nabhi ensures CHANGE in inamimate objects too.&nbsp; Our axis of rotation wobbles like a top,\ntracing a clockwise circle around true north. Called axial precession, it takes\nabout 25,765 years to complete the full circle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Precession occurs, &nbsp;because the sun and moon exert a gravitational\npull on the earth\u2019s equatorial bulge. Vishnu avatar Varaha has done the placing\nwell.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fluctuations in the\namount of incoming solar radiation is the cause of large-scale changes in\nEarth's climate during the Quaternary.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/dJ5GYQrkvxI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/dJ5GYQrkvxI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Variations in the\nintensity and timing of heat from the sun are the cause of the\nglacial/interglacial cycles. Throughout the Quaternary period, high latitude\nwinters have been cold enough to allow snow to accumulate.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is when the\nsummers are cold, (i.e., summers that occur when the sun is at its farthest\npoint in Earth's orbit), that the snows of previous winters do not melt completely.\nWhen this process continues for centuries, ice sheets begin to form.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Finally,\nthe shape of Earth's orbit also changes. At one extreme, the orbit is more\ncircular, so that each season receives about the same amount of incoming solar radiation.\nAt the other extreme, the orbital ellipse is stretched longer, exaggerating the\ndifferences between seasons.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The eccentricity of Earth's orbit also proceeds\nthrough a long cycle, which takes 100,000 years. Major glacial events in the\nQuaternary have coincided when the phases of axial tilt, precession of\nequinoxes and eccentricity of orbit are all lined up to give the northern\nhemisphere the least amount of summer solar radiation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/tPH23RMkegw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/tPH23RMkegw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Al Gore is on course to be the \u201cworld\u2019s first carbon billionaire\u201d thanks to his\ninvestments in green companies . . . all of which benefit from tax dollars and\ngovernment loans to \u201cprevent global warming.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide absorbs\ninfrared radiation (IR) in only three narrow bands of frequencies, which\ncorrespond to wavelengths of 2.7, 4.3 and 15 micrometers (\u00b5m),\nrespectively.&nbsp; The percentage absorption\nof all three lines combined can be very generously estimated at about 8% of the\nwhole IR spectrum, which means that 92% of the \u201cheat\u201d passes right through\nwithout being absorbed by CO2.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; When sulfur dioxide mixes with moisture in clouds, it\ncreates acid rain&nbsp; .&nbsp;&nbsp; Scrubbers help to remove most of the sulfur\noxides from the smoke stack exhaust of a power plant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The smoke from the\nburning coal first goes through a particulate filter to remove soot and ash. &nbsp;Then it enters a scrubber. In the scrubber,\nthere is a water spray that produces a cloud of fine water droplets. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RKzLA_wX_yY/VPWYfVK9FOI/AAAAAAAA1t4/NKOkykW8b5Q/s1600/300px-Flue_gas_desulfurization_unit_EN.svg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RKzLA_wX_yY/VPWYfVK9FOI/AAAAAAAA1t4/NKOkykW8b5Q/s1600/300px-Flue_gas_desulfurization_unit_EN.svg.png\" width=\"563\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The water is mixed with\ncrushed limestone, which reacts with the sulfur and pulls it out of the\nexhaust. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The acid fraud says that humans are putting\nmore carbon dioxide into the oceans (through the atmosphere), and the CO2\nconverts to acid in the oceans, while corals are supposedly sensitive to acid\nand cannot produce their calcium shells in such an environment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; The damage to coral reefs\nwhich has been occurring is caused by pollution , heat, disease, etc., but not\nby acidity of the ocean water caused by Carbon dioxide .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oceans have such a huge\npotential to neutralize acid that no significant pH change is occurring. And\nall biological cells have evolved the ability to cope with pH changes. The\npropaganda is a mindless argument over the chemistry of calcium without a trace\nof real biology or truth of evolution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Part of the carbon\nwhich enters the oceans is converted into neutral cell mass; and this is one of\nthe reasons why there is no acid problem. Biology converts CO2 into neutral\ncell mass.&nbsp; &nbsp;Physiology totally controls pH within cells.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This means that the pH of ocean water has no relationship to the pH within the\ncells, where calcium carbonate shells are created.&nbsp; For the frauds to claim that a small fraction\nof a pH change in the ocean cannot be handled by corals and shells is a\ncontrivance in conflict with biological principles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild\u2019s propagandists\nclaim carbon dioxide is an acid, and acid destroys carbonate in the ocean,\nwhile corals require carbonate. But CO2 isn't just an acid; it is in\nequilibrium with carbonate. This means more CO2 entering the oceans results in\nmore carbonate, not less.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two\nscientific frauds involved. One is to view CO2 only as an acid, as if it were\nequivalent to hydrochloric acid, while ignoring its equilibrium with carbonate.\nThe other fraud is to ignore the huge buffering capacity of the oceans, which\nresults in no detectable acidity from CO2 entering the oceans. .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Near the\nsurface of the oceans, increased photosynthesis creates alkalinity rather than\nacidity. There is in fact a shortage of acid near the surface for the promotion\nof photosynthesis. The decay which creates acidity occurs 1-2 kilometers down,\nwhich is way below the level of coral reefs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When oceans can hold no\nmore CO2, they leave some in the atmosphere. As their temperatures increase,\noceans release more CO2.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oceans constantly increase in temperature between ice\nages causing a constant increase in CO2 in the atmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium carbonate is a\nstrong buffer at pH 8.1. At that pH, water strongly absorbs CO2, which is an\nacid being absorbed by an alkali.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oceans are alkaline at pH 8.1. This means\nthere are less than one tenth as many hydrogen ions in the oceans as in neutral\nwater. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When carbon dioxide\ndissolves in water it exists in chemical equilibrium producing carbonic acid<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 + H2O = H2CO3<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This acid is just too\nweak. &nbsp;&nbsp;Carbonic acid is the only acid excreted as gas\nfrom the human lungs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity is a measure\nof the capacity of water or any solution to neutralize or \u201cbuffer\u201d acids.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity is important to aquatic organisms\nbecause it protects them against rapid changes in pH.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity should not\nbe confused with pH. The reason alkalinity is sometime confused with pH is because\nthe term alkaline is used to describe pH conditions greater than 7.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ejRFCNrMZP4/VPaW90gmV7I/AAAAAAAA1xE/tlVWXA4N4HI/s1600/imagesCA7789PJ08.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"340\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ejRFCNrMZP4/VPaW90gmV7I/AAAAAAAA1xE/tlVWXA4N4HI/s1600/imagesCA7789PJ08.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pH scale is from\nzero to 14.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Neutral fresh water pH\nis zero . In pure water which is neutral, the conc of Hydrogen ion is 10 raised\nto -7 equivalent/litre which corresponds to pH of 7. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zero pH is an acid of\nhighest strength like Hydrochloric acid . pH 14 is a base of highest strength\nlike Caustic .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">pH is a measure of\nhydrogen ion concentration in that solution. A small change in pH represents a\nlarge change in hydrogen ion concentration. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the conc of H+ ions\nincrease by 10 times, the value of pH decreases by one unit and vice versa.\nThis is because the pH scale is logarithmic. This means each change of one in\npH value is 10 times more acidic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So a substance with pH\n2 is 1000 times more acidic than one with pH 5. In other words ( better to\nunderstand this well ) diluting a strong acid of pH 2 , ten times increase the\npH value to pH 3.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Neutral or pure water\nhas an equal conc of H+ ions and OH- ions. When an acid is added the conc of H+\nions become greater than that of OH- ions. Similarly when a base is added the\nconc of OH- ions increases while that of H+ decreases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">pH changes with temp.\nIt decreases on heating. pH of boiling water is 6.56.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pH of pure water drops\nfrom 7 to 5.5 due to some reaction in water when splashed in air. &nbsp;Rain pH is 5.6 as CO2 dissolves to form\ncarbonic acid. How do I know all this.&nbsp; Because\non Chemical tankers we spray De-ionised water to clean cargo tanks.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Al fuckin\u2019 Gore and his\nscientist chamchas will NOT understand all this .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Basically pH scale\nmeasures the amount of H+ and OH-. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person cannot survive\nif his blood ph drops to 7 or rises to 7.8. The BUFFERING capacity of blood\nprevents such swings in pH level.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The process by which H+\nor OH- ions are removed so that pH remains constant is known as BUFFER action.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Hullo CKD Gore (</span><i> <span style=\"color: blue;\">choot ka dhakkan</span></i><span style=\"color: red;\"> ), kuch samaj mein aaya ?</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nature has provided\namazing&nbsp; insurance policies ( BUFFERS )\nto protect oceans against rising acidity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One source of\nalkalinity in sea water is calcium carbonate (CaCO3), which is dissolved in\nwater flowing / in contact through geology that has limestone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity can increase\nthe pH (make water more basic), when the alkalinity comes from a mineral source\nsuch as calcium carbonate (CaCO3).&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;When CaCO3 dissolves in water, the carbonate can\nreact with water to form bicarbonate , which produces hydroxide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corals, molluscs and\nfish rely on abundant calcium carbonate in the water to build their skeletons\nand shells.&nbsp; &nbsp;Adding carbon dioxide to sea water increases\nthe availability of carbonate&nbsp; ions to\nall marine life.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adding hydrochloric\nacid to sea water like what <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">CKD </b>Gore/ &nbsp;R stooge scientists did causes the\ndestruction of carbonates and the release of carbon dioxide. &nbsp;&nbsp;People running domestic aquariums know that additional\ncarbon dioxide always benefits life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God ( not <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">CKD</b> Darwin ) has\nmade a &nbsp;\u201cbuffered system\u201d in oceans that\nis very resistant to changes and maintains a fairly constant pH.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Increasing CO2 merely causes more Calcium\nCarbonate solid to form without much change in pH.&nbsp; Decreasing CO2 dissolves more Calcium\nCarbonate to restore the balance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Doubling the current\nvalue of 395 ppm CO2 to 790 ppm will reduce the pH by only 0.19<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WS4q-MkHUgc/VPabhHzvELI/AAAAAAAA1xQ/tlsmymiUBuc/s1600/Embargoed%2BJune%2B27%2B-%2BThe3c%2Bchalk%2Bcliffs%2Bat%2BDover.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"424\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WS4q-MkHUgc/VPabhHzvELI/AAAAAAAA1xQ/tlsmymiUBuc/s1600/Embargoed%2BJune%2B27%2B-%2BThe3c%2Bchalk%2Bcliffs%2Bat%2BDover.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Above : The white cliffs of Dover -- Calcium Carbonate &nbsp;.</b></span></i></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b>Digression: &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b>Once while approaching London I head a BONG officer on VHF - &nbsp;\" Dobber pilot, &nbsp;Dobber pilot-- this is Indian SUKKA ROTI calling \" &nbsp;- </b><i>read that as a ship named MV. Indian Security .</i></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ocean is a powerful\nBUFFER and storehouse for Carbon dioxide.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nature routinely\nremoves excess carbon compounds from the ocean waters in tonnages so massive\nthat man can only measure and wonder. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only when you see the white cliffs\nof Dover you get to know the magnitude (45% by weight of these thick beds\nrepresents carbon dioxide that was extracted from the atmosphere by the ocean.).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below: Henry's law and pH&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/gUfhvbnBWs0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/gUfhvbnBWs0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe>\\</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Henry\u2019s law describes\nonly the physical equilibrium between the phases and may only be applied to the\nfraction of the gas that is molecularly dissolved and not chemically bound.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Henry\u2019s\nlaw coefficient depends on the type of the gas and the solvent, the\ntemperature, the total pressure and in the case of salt solutions it also\ndepends on the ionic strength of the solution.</span> &nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Henry\u2019s law coefficient of CO2\ndecreases with increasing temperature. The Henry\u2019s law coefficient also decreases\nwith increasing salinity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>Below: Dissolved CO2 in water and temperature. &nbsp;When oceans get heated due to global warming CO2 is expelled&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/FMSdiO8Z5Gs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/FMSdiO8Z5Gs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An everyday example of\nHenry's law is given by carbonated soft drinks. Before the bottle or can of\ncarbonated drink is opened, the gas above the drink is almost pure carbon\ndioxide at a pressure slightly higher than atmospheric pressure. The drink\nitself contains dissolved carbon dioxide.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the bottle or can is opened,\nthis gas escapes, giving the characteristic hiss. Because the partial pressure\nof carbon dioxide above the liquid is now much lower, some of the dissolved\ncarbon dioxide comes out of solution as bubbles.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a glass of the drink is\nleft in the open, the concentration of carbon dioxide in solution will come\ninto equilibrium with the carbon dioxide in the air, and the drink will go\n\"flat\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The solubility of Co2\nin water is directly proportional to the partial pressure of the gas above the\nliquid.</span> &nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the\ntemperature of a system changes, the Henry constant will also change.</span> &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nA<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">t one atmosphere\npressure and 25 C about 0.7 liters of carbon dioxide can be dissolved in one\nliter of water. &nbsp;&nbsp;So all you have to do\nto make carbonic acid is to bubble carbon dioxide through water.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is possible to\ndissolve a lot more than 0.7 liters of CO2 in water by increasing gas pressure\nabove the water.&nbsp; &nbsp;As the pressure increases, more and more CO2\nis dissolved and &nbsp;the concentration of\ncarbonic acid increases in tandem.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At one atmosphere\npressure, about half the CO2 produced by both natural and human activity is\ndissolved in the oceans because of Henry\u2019s law.&nbsp;\nThe oceans gobble up a lot of CO2.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the carbon\ndioxide produced in modern times by the increased burning of carbon fuels has disappeared. &nbsp;As man creates it faster, nature is removing\nit at a faster rate. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oceans &nbsp;dump excess\ncarbonates on the sea floor.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All marine plants\nremove carbon dioxide from sea water, and aquatic animals get their carbon from\nplants. &nbsp;Therefore, to maintain healthy\nmarine life requires a constant supply of carbon dioxide.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Marine algae /pythoplanktons remain on\nsurface of sea ( they need sunlight ) gulp fantastic amounts carbon di oxide\nand release oxygen. Mind you, carbon dioxide is heavier than air and they come down to the surface of the sea.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The carbon dioxide\ncontent of the ocean generally increases with depth because the deeper water is\ngenerally colder and also because plants that use photosynthesis to remove\ncarbondioxide from the water cannot operate this process without sunlight. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition, deep sea animal life continues to\nexhale carbon dioxide and decaying organic material strips away oxygen and\ngenerates more carbon dioxide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide is very\nsoluble in sea water.&nbsp; The carbon dioxide\nthat enters the ocean is first dissolved as a gas, which can bubble out again\nif the temperature of the water rises. &nbsp;The\ndissolved gas is soon converted to H2CO3,&nbsp;\ncarbonic acid, which then forms bicarbonate and carbonate ions. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These reactions release&nbsp; acidic hydrogen ions which is NO big deal. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is therefore theoretically\ntrue on PAPER that sea water absorbs carbon dioxide and this &nbsp;process will decrease its alkalinity. &nbsp;&nbsp;However\nthe acid created in this way has almost NIL ability to change ocean pH.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbonic\nacid is&nbsp; such a weak acid that we drink\nit in soda water.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In my home I drink soda by using a CO2 cylinder machine. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbonic acid is easily\nconverted to neutral compounds or used by marine organisms. &nbsp;Depending on the prevailing pH of the water,\nthis weak acid can react with the abundant calcium bearing compounds being\nwashed into the sea as rocks weather to form calcium carbonate. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This will end up in the\nshells or skeletons of marine creatures, or precipitate out from the water\nforming limestone beds on the sea floor. In this way the ocean disposes of\nexcess carbon dioxide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite the large\nquantity of carbon dioxide stored in the sea, the weak carbonic acid from carbon\ndioxide is very much a WEE player in the acid/alkaline balance in the oceans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warm water expels\ncarbon dioxide and cold water takes it into solution, so daily, seasonal and cyclic\nchanges in ocean temperature have a major effect on the carbon dioxide\ndissolved in sea water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity is a\nmeasurement of the buffering ability of the solution. &nbsp;Water high in alkalinity will be able maintain\nits pH despite the addition of acids.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To\nsay that the miniscule &nbsp;contribution of\nhumans to carbon dioxide in the&nbsp; atmosphere\nwill somehow put so much carbon dioxide into the oceans as to alter the blood&nbsp; chemistry of fishes and threaten their\nsurvival is just plain bullsh#t.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/g4bftQ4xxFc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/g4bftQ4xxFc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The carbonate system is\na weak acid-base system which exists in seawater as dissolved carbon dioxide,\ncarbonic acid, bicarbonate and carbonate ions and complexes of these ions.\nBasically the system is derived from the dissolution of carbon dioxide gas and\ncarbonate minerals into the water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fine-grained clays and\nother reactive sediments eroded from the land and washed into the oceans by\nrivers also play a major role in buffering the pH of ocean waters. &nbsp;The system at any time is always tending\ntowards a point of equilibrium where there is no net movement of carbon dioxide\nbetween the ocean and the atmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Almost all life on\nEarth evolved in eras when there was far more carbon dioxide in the atmosphere\nthan today; it will surely cope with any changes in water temperature or pH caused\nby man's WEE \u2013 nay - &nbsp;PISSFART, activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">Below: I learnt this in school 47 years ago &nbsp;--show how illiterate <b><span style=\"color: red;\">CKD </span></b>Al Gore is ..</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3pD68uxRLkM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/3pD68uxRLkM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The availability of\ncarbon dioxide is the limiting factor for plant growth in water and is often\nthelimiting factor for land plants. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is also a myth that acidic water\nnecessarily kills plant and animal life. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rain water is slightly</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">acidic, sometimes with a pH as low as 5.5 (\nDUE TO CARBONIC ACID )</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2013 far more acidic\nthan the oceans (approx. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">pH 8.1).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But once rain water is\nstores in a &nbsp;tank, rain water returns to\na neutral state of 7.&nbsp; </span>&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fresh water does not have the\nability of the vast seas to buffer the acidity that can be caused by carbon\ndioxide.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fresh and saline swamps and reed beds the water\ncan become quite acidic, but plant and animal life nevertheless flourish there.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plant\nnurseries have long known the benefits of pumping carbon dioxide into the air\nin their greenhouses. Nurserymen who grow aquatic plants and animals have also\nfound the benefits of water acidified by carbon dioxide.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nwater cycle, the mineral cycle, the carbon cycle and the solar cycle drive\neverything. The atmospheric gases of life are crucial \u2013 oxygen for animals,\ncarbon dioxide for plants, nitrogen for the soil and water for everything.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon\nis thus the key element in all farmed food but carbon dioxide is the rarest by\nfar of the atmospheric gases of life, comprising just 0.039% of the atmospheric\ngases. Most life on earth is limited by this shortage of carbon dioxide.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pastures flourish best after the first summer storms. This is a time when the\nocean is expelling carbon dioxide, the sun is providing more warmth. thousands\nof laboratory and field experiments have conclusively demonstrated that\nenriching the air with carbon dioxide stimulates the growth and development of\nnearly all plants.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They have also\nrevealed that higher-than-normal CO2 concentrations dramatically enhance the\nefficiency with which plants utilize water, sometimes as much as doubling it in\nresponse to a doubling of the air's CO2 content.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact, atmospheric CO2 enrichment can\nactually mean the difference between life and death for vegetation growing in\nextremely stressful circumstances.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Carbon dioxide\nemissions resulting from the burning of fossil fuels should not be feared; they\nare something to be celebrated!<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Salts and other\nchemicals in the oceans buffer and dampen the effects of any chemical change. Carbon\ndioxide is an essential resource for all corals for two reasons. &nbsp;Firstly, carbon dioxide is essential to\ncreating more carbonates in sea water.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These carbonates are the building blocks\nfor coral formation and for the calcification of shells of other marine creatures.\nSecondly, corals exist in a symbiotic relationship with minute plants (algae)\nwhich are greatly enriched by increased carbon dioxide in the water. As the\nalgae flourish, so do the corals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every child amateur\naquarium owner know this and inject carbon dioxide into their tanks. Coral\nbleaching is usually an indication of stress or death of these plants. Like\nland pastures, coral pastures are stressed by sudden bouts of high temperature.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sudden high temperature itself cause stress, and this is multiplied when\nthe high water temperature drives off the carbon dioxide which is the food of\nplants. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corals may be harmed by runoff\nfrom the land such as GM herbicides which damage algae, or pesticides that may\nharm coral polyps. Excessive amounts of sewerage sludge may even cause a\ndeficiency of oxygen or an excess of harmful bacteria.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But it is hard to\nimagine or point to a circumstance where atmospheric carbon dioxide from any\nsource has harmed or could harm corals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; And not\nall acids are the same, and not all carbonates are the same.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium carbonate, the tough material of\nseashells and corals, sometimes take the form of calcite, and at other times\nform a chemically identical form of the mineral, called aragonite, that is more\nsoluble in acids.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PURE CARBON IT IS !!.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-APrzxdOonVo/VPcBgg8HdgI/AAAAAAAA1x4/XsK2bReQpFc/s1600/downloa7jsd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"274\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-APrzxdOonVo/VPcBgg8HdgI/AAAAAAAA1x4/XsK2bReQpFc/s1600/downloa7jsd.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diamond is the\nmetastable form, and over time will ultimately turn to graphite.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-gQYDcSa4ORY/VPcBJPaKDbI/AAAAAAAA1xw/ZOf8z5JjSUY/s1600/4eccf97ce4b04e045ae56d8891-churringo-1327525329213-diamondstructuregraphitestructure1.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium carbonate\nusually crystallizes as calcite, &nbsp;but\nsurprisingly, it forms aragonite in seawater.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The outcome affects many\ndifferent processes \u2014 including the global carbon cycle, neutralizing carbon\ndioxide in the atmosphere into a stable mineral and limiting its buildup in the\nair. The shells &nbsp;and corals, have\naragonite . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ratio of calcium to\nmagnesium in the water affects the surface energy of the nucleating crystals;\nwhen that ratio passes a specific value, it tips the balance from forming\ncalcite to forming aragonite.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcite, aragonite and\nmag-rich calcite vary in solubility in acids. The sea contains carbonates and\nbasic chemicals and clays all of which buffer any disturbance to ocean pH\nmaking it difficult for natural carbon dioxide to create acidic water in open\noceans. CKD Al Gore has NO dang idea how much water exists in oceans.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ocean covers more\nthan 71 percent of the surface of our planet ,and much of the ocean is 3 -5 km deep . Carbon\ndioxide comprises just 0.039% of the atmosphere and man contributes less than &nbsp;3% of this.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is impossible to\ndetermine a meaningful figure for \"average\" ocean acidity (pH). It is\nalso impossible to say with any certainty that average ocean pH has changed\nbecause &nbsp;of man's use of carbon fuels. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such \"measurements\" are an exercise\nin writing the answer first and walking back on BIG BROTHERs orders\u2014who is Al\nfuckin\u2019 Gore\u2019s boss .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Hu_Ga0JYFNg/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/Hu_Ga0JYFNg?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pH of the oceans\nvaries naturally from place to place and time to time, depending on\ntemperatures , river water run offs, and the activities of plant and animal\nlife. Cold ocean currents from the deep ocean periodically up-well to the\nsurface.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gehjZJsufp4/VPcNk0XScqI/AAAAAAAA1yQ/DdoKrQqJUy0/s1600/078.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"297\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gehjZJsufp4/VPcNk0XScqI/AAAAAAAA1yQ/DdoKrQqJUy0/s1600/078.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These currents are rich in dissolved carbon dioxide and other\nchemicals and decayed organic matter. Where this cold nutrient-rich water\nsurfaces, there is a staggering profusion of aquatic life.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Oe56uNZpIbI/VPcNEgFMKSI/AAAAAAAA1yI/Vth6g8vlizA/s1600/f-d-7c15835b16594e86dd456d6d5eade86c3cc347b416542445b8fe494a%2BIMAGE_THUMB_POSTCARD%2BIMAGE_THUMB_POSTCARD.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"303\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Oe56uNZpIbI/VPcNEgFMKSI/AAAAAAAA1yI/Vth6g8vlizA/s1600/f-d-7c15835b16594e86dd456d6d5eade86c3cc347b416542445b8fe494a%2BIMAGE_THUMB_POSTCARD%2BIMAGE_THUMB_POSTCARD.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oceans have a huge\ncapacity resist being destabilised by changes in temperature or composition of\nthe atmosphere. Whenever there is a change, the reactions of other chemicals or\nlife in the sea act to moderate and even reverse those changes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oceans have an\nunlimited ability to remove carbon dioxide from their waters and store it in\nthick beds of shells and corals, limestone, chalk, dolomite, magnesite,\nsiderite, marls, methane hydrate and oil shales. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fresh water swamps and\nlakes on land have also laid down massive deposits of coal and lignite formed\nfrom carbon dioxide extracted from the atmosphere. Many of these deposits were\nlaid down when the carbon dioxide content of the atmosphere was far higher than\nit is today.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide present\nin the oceans is essential to plant life and current very low levels of carbon\ndioxide in the atmosphere and the ocean are limiting plant growth. All animal\nlife depends on these plants. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Man's mining and\nindustrial activities are harmlessly recycling some of this valuable carbon\ndioxide from natural limestones and hydrocarbons buried in the dead lithosphere,\nback to the living biosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Zhrdo0q6IDA/VPcOmmqIEII/AAAAAAAA1yc/DocasB-rJEQ/s1600/methane-vs-2co2-gguuraphic-new.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
